trans-unit.source: Creating .NET Applications Using TPM OM REST API
trans-unit.target: Creating .NET Applications Using TPM OM REST API

trans-unit.source: Use the WCF Data Services to create .NET applications that consume the data services exposed by the TPM OM.
trans-unit.target: Use the WCF Data Services to create .NET applications that consume the data services exposed by the TPM OM.

trans-unit.source: The TPM OM API is based on the OData protocol.
trans-unit.target: The TPM OM API is based on the OData protocol.

trans-unit.source: This topic provides instructions on how to create .NET applications to perform operations on the TPM OM entities, such as defining partners, creating agreements, and so on.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides instructions on how to create .NET applications to perform operations on the TPM OM entities, such as defining partners, creating agreements, and so on.

trans-unit.source: Typical Code Flow for using the API
trans-unit.target: Typical Code Flow for using the API

trans-unit.source: The following illustration captures a typical code flow for creating a .NET application to use the TPM OM REST API:
trans-unit.target: The following illustration captures a typical code flow for creating a .NET application to use the TPM OM REST API:

trans-unit.source: Set up Your Computer
trans-unit.target: Set up Your Computer

trans-unit.source: To start creating .NET applications for consuming data services exposed by TPM OM API, install <token>vs2012</token> and <token>ssAstoria</token> 5.0:
trans-unit.target: To start creating .NET applications for consuming data services exposed by TPM OM API, install <token>vs2012</token> and <token>ssAstoria</token> 5.0:

trans-unit.source: Install Visual Studio from <externalLink><linkText>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dd831853</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dd831853</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Install Visual Studio from <externalLink><linkText>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dd831853</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dd831853</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Install WCF Data Services from <externalLink><linkText>http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=29306</linkText><linkUri>http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=29306</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Install WCF Data Services from <externalLink><linkText>http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=29306</linkText><linkUri>http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=29306</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: If you used a self-signed certificate while provisioning <token>af_integration_full</token>, you must add that certificate to trusted certificate store on the computer where you use the TPM OM API.
trans-unit.target: If you used a self-signed certificate while provisioning <token>af_integration_full</token>, you must add that certificate to trusted certificate store on the computer where you use the TPM OM API.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, you get error - <codeInline>The underlying connection was closed: Could not establish "trust relationship for the SSL/TLS secure channel</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, you get error - <codeInline>The underlying connection was closed: Could not establish "trust relationship for the SSL/TLS secure channel</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: You do not need to perform this step if you used a certificate from a trusted signing authority.
trans-unit.target: You do not need to perform this step if you used a certificate from a trusted signing authority.

trans-unit.source: The First Steps
trans-unit.target: The First Steps

trans-unit.source: This section lists the overall set of instructions that you must follow to create a .NET application using the TPM OM REST API.
trans-unit.target: This section lists the overall set of instructions that you must follow to create a .NET application using the TPM OM REST API.

trans-unit.source: The instructions in this section assume that you create a C# application.
trans-unit.target: The instructions in this section assume that you create a C# application.

trans-unit.source: To create a C# application
trans-unit.target: To create a C# application

trans-unit.source: Create a <token>vs_current_short</token> C# project.
trans-unit.target: Create a <token>vs_current_short</token> C# project.

trans-unit.source: In the project Solution Explorer, right-click <embeddedLabel>References</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>Add Service Reference</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the project Solution Explorer, right-click <embeddedLabel>References</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>Add Service Reference</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the Add Service Reference dialog box, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the Add Service Reference dialog box, do the following:

trans-unit.source: For the address, enter the URL where the TPM OM service metadata is hosted and select <embeddedLabel>Go</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For the address, enter the URL where the TPM OM service metadata is hosted and select <embeddedLabel>Go</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: A typical URL for metadata looks like:
trans-unit.target: A typical URL for metadata looks like:

trans-unit.source: In this URL, <codeInline>https://mybiztalkservice.biztalk.windows.net</codeInline> is your deployment URL, <codeInline>default</codeInline> is the default namespace, and <codeInline>$PartnerManagement</codeInline> is the endpoint suffix to retrieve the metadata.
trans-unit.target: In this URL, <codeInline>https://mybiztalkservice.biztalk.windows.net</codeInline> is your deployment URL, <codeInline>default</codeInline> is the default namespace, and <codeInline>$PartnerManagement</codeInline> is the endpoint suffix to retrieve the metadata.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Namespace</embeddedLabel> text box, enter a namespace, such as <userInput>PartnerManagement</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Namespace</embeddedLabel> text box, enter a namespace, such as <userInput>PartnerManagement</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> to add the reference to the <token>vs_current_short</token> project.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> to add the reference to the <token>vs_current_short</token> project.

trans-unit.source: In the .cs file, add a reference to the service namespace.
trans-unit.target: In the .cs file, add a reference to the service namespace.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the namespace for your C# project is <codeInline>BtsServices</codeInline> and the namespace for the service reference is <codeInline>PartnerManagement</codeInline>, add the following reference to your .cs file:
trans-unit.target: For example, if the namespace for your C# project is <codeInline>BtsServices</codeInline> and the namespace for the service reference is <codeInline>PartnerManagement</codeInline>, add the following reference to your .cs file:

trans-unit.source: You can now start creating the entities, set their properties, and create relationships between the entities.
trans-unit.target: You can now start creating the entities, set their properties, and create relationships between the entities.

trans-unit.source: Whenever you commit changes to the service context, you must always use the <embeddedLabel>Batch</embeddedLabel> save option.
trans-unit.target: Whenever you commit changes to the service context, you must always use the <embeddedLabel>Batch</embeddedLabel> save option.

trans-unit.source: You can either set this option once when you create the context by using the following:
trans-unit.target: You can either set this option once when you create the context by using the following:

trans-unit.source: Or, you can use it every time you save changes to a context.
trans-unit.target: Or, you can use it every time you save changes to a context.
